page.title: 09Canals.
page.content: The two canals in our area are the Stainforth and Keadby and the New Junction they become one canal south of Bramwith lock. The two canals have to be crossed where ever one enters the village of Kirk Bramwith making an island of the village. An act of Parliament granted building of the S.&K.canal in 1809.this canal is now only used by pleasure boats,but development of a terminous at Keadby is planned. The N.J.canal was built in 1905 it crosses the River Don by aqueduct and was recently widened and electrically operated canti-lever and swing bridges have been installed.This canaljoins the Aire and Calder and then goes on to the port of Goole. .
